title: CryptoGrizzly
author: CryptoGrizzly
content: I am currently mining Nexa and finally getting paid out and making a small profit.I did an exchange on TradeOrge but I can only get USDT ERC20. The fees are way to much to transfer USDT ERC20.Looking for an exchange that will exchange Nexa to USDT TRC20 to cut down on fees.Thanks in advance!

comments.author: Dowper_
comments.body: https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/nexa/markets/ - Here you can find other Nexa exchanges.

comments.author: CryptoGrizzly
comments.body: Quote from: Dowper_ on April 16, 2023, 08:40:30 PMhttps://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/nexa/markets/ - Here you can find other Nexa exchanges.Thank you for the link.Which exchange from the list uses USDT TRC20?

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoGrizzly on April 16, 2023, 11:42:01 PMWhich exchange from the list uses USDT TRC20?When someone sends you a link, I think it's best you make some of the discoveries yourself, buddy. Along the way, you get to learn a lot of things as you experience them first hand rather than just be told answersAnyway, try MEXCI sent some USDT TRC20 out of it a few hours ago.

comments.author: safar1980
comments.body: Not KYChttps://xeggex.com/market/NEXA_USDTMiners praised this exchange in chats, just do not mine on the exchange wallet. Try to change some coins and evaluate the service. I registered on this exchange, there are a lot of coins for mining and a good interface.

comments.author: batsonxl
comments.body: Try this nexa>usdt then usdt>xlm then send it to any exchange you like then xlm>usdt. This way you will spend most less fee for transaction. Xlm takes only pennies for sending

comments.author: sxemini
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoGrizzly on April 16, 2023, 06:58:03 PMI am currently mining Nexa and finally getting paid out and making a small profit.I did an exchange on TradeOrge but I can only get USDT ERC20. The fees are way to much to transfer USDT ERC20.Looking for an exchange that will exchange Nexa to USDT TRC20 to cut down on fees.Thanks in advance!Mine on zergpool and get paid direct in btc / eth / flux / usdt / ...... is the shortest and easiest way. Zergpool so underrated here.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Approximately six weeks ago, we shared our expectations regarding the integration time frame with you, noting that it typically takes between 2 to 6 weeks for crypto assets to be integrated within exchanges. Today, we find ourselves nearing the end of this period.We now looking forward Nexa (NEXA) to be listed on the BingX exchange in the second part of February, which is approximately three weeks from the time we writing this article. This adjustment to our initial estimate is due to the complexities involved in the integration process.https://medium.com/@nexacoin/important-update-anticipated-listing-on-bingx-exchange-cda245f12f41

comments.author: merekamo
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoGrizzly on April 16, 2023, 11:42:01 PMQuote from: Dowper_ on April 16, 2023, 08:40:30 PMhttps://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/nexa/markets/ - Here you can find other Nexa exchanges.Thank you for the link.Which exchange from the list uses USDT TRC20?I agree with other comment, and this applies if you are looking for a market where tokens are sold, in the OP's case, namely Nexa, because this token is already listed on CMC, then look for the market there. If I look in coinmarketcap, try Mexc to sell your Nexa. Now, Mexc don't has KYC to withdraw and It's better if you choose in below list in CMC like coinEx, Xeggex orÂ  etc. If you can see red sign in cmc, I think it means deposit or withdraw not available. I don't check it but actually I often like that.
